title: Build wound assessment analyzer with image-based healing metrics

requirements.text: Create image upload interface that accepts wound photographs and displays the uploaded image for analysis
acceptanceCriteria: User can upload wound images
Uploaded image is displayed in the interface
Interface supports common image formats (JPG, PNG)

acceptanceCriteria: System calculates wound area in pixels from uploaded image
Area measurement is displayed to user
Interpretation guidance is shown (decreasing = good healing, increasing = delayed healing or infection)

requirements.text: Calculate wound perimeter and analyze smoothness, displaying results with clinical interpretation (smooth, smaller perimeter indicates healing; large or irregular perimeter indicates inflammation)

acceptanceCriteria: System calculates wound perimeter from image
Smoothness metric is computed and displayed
Clinical interpretation is provided based on perimeter characteristics

requirements.text: Analyze wound shape regularity and circularity, displaying metrics with interpretation (high circularity indicates better contraction; irregular shape indicates tissue damage or slow healing)

Display results with interpretation that increase in red/pink indicates improvement and increase in yellow/black indicates concern.

acceptanceCriteria: System analyzes color composition and calculates percentages of red, pink, yellow, and black
Each color percentage is displayed with its clinical meaning
Interpretation highlights whether color distribution indicates improvement or concern
Color composition is marked as a critical metric in the UI

requirements.text: Analyze wound texture smoothness and display results with interpretation (smooth texture indicates tissue recovery)
acceptanceCriteria: Texture smoothness metric is calculated from wound image
Results show whether texture is smooth or rough
Clinical interpretation links smooth texture to tissue recovery

requirements.text: Detect wound edge sharpness and boundary definition, displaying results with interpretation (sharp edges indicate stabilized healing; fuzzy edges indicate active inflammation)

quotes: ü©∫ 6Ô∏è‚É£ Edge Sharpness / boundary Sharp edges ‚Üí stabilized healing. Fuzzy edges ‚Üí active inflammation.

Results distinguish between sharp and fuzzy edges
Interpretation correlates edge sharpness with healing status or inflammation

requirements.text: Detect exudate and moisture appearance by identifying shiny or fluid regions in the wound image, displaying results with interpretation (too wet or glossy indicates risk of poor healing)

quotes: ü©∫ 7Ô∏è‚É£ Exudate / Moisture Appearance (if visible) Detects shiny or fluid regions. Too wet or glossy ‚Üí risk of poor healing.

acceptanceCriteria: System detects shiny or fluid regions in wound images
Moisture level assessment is displayed
Interpretation warns when excessive moisture indicates poor healing risk

requirements.text: Create a comprehensive results dashboard that displays all seven wound metrics together with visual indicators, clinical interpretations, and overall healing status summary
acceptanceCriteria: All seven metrics are displayed in a unified dashboard view
Each metric shows its value and clinical interpretation
Visual indicators (colors, icons) help users quickly assess healing status
Dashboard provides an overall healing summary based on all metrics

requirements.text: Implement wound tracking history that allows users to upload multiple wound images over time and compare measurements to track healing progress
acceptanceCriteria: Users can save multiple assessments for the same wound over time
Historical data shows trends in all seven metrics
Comparison view highlights improvements or deteriorations in healing

requirements.text: Apply a clean, professional medical interface design with a calming green and white color scheme, clear typography optimized for readability of clinical data, and organized layout that prioritizes critical metrics like color composition
acceptanceCriteria: Interface uses medical-appropriate green and white color palette
Typography ensures clinical data is easily readable
Layout hierarchy emphasizes most critical metrics
Design conveys professionalism and trustworthiness suitable for healthcare context

constraints: All image analysis must be performed client-side or through the backend without requiring external AI APIs
Color composition analysis is the highest priority metric and must be prominently displayed
nonGoals: Integration with electronic health record (EHR) systems
HIPAA compliance features or patient data encryption
